forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers before 5pm. Mostly sunny, with a high near 53. West northwest wind 20 to 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 45. South southwest wind 8 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the heart of Downtown San Francisco, the bustle of life intertwines with the elements, giving the city a character that is ever-unfolding. Today, a hint of rain lingers in the air, holding onto the promise of showers before the sun dips beyond the horizon. The atmosphere carries a coolness, with the temperature settling near a modest fifty-three degrees. A fleet of clouds looms overhead, thick and grey, casting a soft shadow over the city and rendering the famed Golden Gate Bridge a near-mythical silhouette against the backdrop of the untamed Bay. Though the morning may present a startling clarity with blustery northwest winds whipping through the streets, a definitive shift is on the horizon as nightfall approaches.

As twilight beckons the rain, now forecasted without reservation, the city dons a more contemplative cloak. Wind gusts swirl, urging those on the streets to seek warmth and shelter, and a stylish, layered outfit might serve best against the elements—perhaps a light waterproof jacket over a cozy sweater. With the impending storm, evening activities turn inward; it’s an ideal time to explore the cozy confines of a local café, sip long-neglected books, or gather with friends for a game night. The calm before the storm imbues a sense of purpose; an invitation not merely to brave the weather but to relish the moments spent together, sheltered from the tempest outside.
